channel.title: Adherent Apologetics
channel.description: Welcome to Adherent Apologetics, where I talk with leading thinkers about Christianity.
channel.itunes:summary: Welcome to Adherent Apologetics, where I talk with leading thinkers about Christianity. If Christianity is true, we shouldn't be afraid to hear what anyone else has to say, so I don't just talk to Christians, but I also talk with Muslims, Jews, atheists, and about anyone else who is willing to talk to me! Join me in learning about Christianity and other worldviews.
channel.itunes:author: Zac Sechler

item.title: How to Read Well | Dr. Karen Swallow Prior | Ep. #275
item.itunes:title: How to Read Well | Dr. Karen Swallow Prior | Ep. #275
item.description:
Karen Swallow Prior earned her Ph.D. in English at the State University of New York at Buffalo. She is a popular writer and speaker, as well as a columnist for Religion News Service. Her writing has appeared in The New York Times, The Atlantic, Vox, The Washington Post, Christianity Today, and many other places. Her most recent book is The Evangelical Imagination: How Stories, Images, and Metaphors Created a Culture in Crisis (Brazos, 2023). In this interview, I talked with Dr. Prior about her book, On Reading Well: Finding the Good Life through Great Books (Brazos, 2018).

Dr. Prior's website: karenswallowprior.com

The Book: https://www.amazon.com/Reading-Well-Finding-through-Great/dp/1587433966

Follow Dr. Prior: https://twitter.com/KSPrior?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor

-------------------------------- GIVING --------------------------------

Please consider becoming a Patron!

Patreon (Thanks!): https://www.patreon.com/AdherentApologetics

YouTube Membership: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCO8jj_CQwrRRwwwXBndo6nQ/join

item.title: God’s Grandeur & The Case For Intelligent Design | Dr. Brian Miller | Ep. #266
item.itunes:title: God’s Grandeur & The Case For Intelligent Design | Dr. Brian Miller | Ep. #266
item.description:
In this interview, I chat with Dr. Brian Miller about the Case for Intelligent Design. Brian Miller is research coordinator for the Center for Science and Culture at Discovery Institute. He holds a B.S. in physics with a minor in engineering from MIT and a Ph.D. in physics from Duke University. He speaks internationally on the topics of intelligent design and the impact of worldviews on society, and is a primary organizer of the Conference on Engineering in the Life Sciences (CELS). He also has consulted on organizational development and strategic planning, and he is a founding member of an innovation consortium that developed into TheStartup, a virtual incubator dedicated to bringing innovation to the marketplace. He has contributed to multiple books and journals covering the debate over intelligent design, including The Mystery of Life's Origin: The Continuing Controversy, The Comprehensive Guide to Science and Faith, and Inference Review. Check out the book and the Sophia Institute!

Link for Purchase: https://sophiainstitute.com/product/gods-grandeur/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/SophiaInstitutePress/

Twitter: https://twitter.com/SophiaPress

-------------------------------- GIVING --------------------------------

Please consider becoming a Patron!

Patreon (Thanks!): https://www.patreon.com/AdherentApologetics

YouTube Membership: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCO8jj_CQwrRRwwwXBndo6nQ/join

item.title: Can God Command Us to Hate Him? | Dr. Thomas Ward | Ep. #262
item.itunes:title: Can God Command Us to Hate Him? | Dr. Thomas Ward | Ep. #262
item.description:
Dr. Thomas Ward is a philosophy professor at Baylor University and the author of Ordered by Love (Angelico Press, 2022), Divine Ideas (Cambridge University Press, 2020) and John Duns Scotus on Parts, Wholes, and Hylomorphism (Brill, 2014). In this interview, I talk with Dr. Ward about his paper, Omnipotence and the Morality of Hating God.

The Paper: https://philpapers.org/rec/WAROAT-2

His Website: https://www.thomasmward.com/

item.title: Hugh Ross: The People, Events, and Ideas that Shaped Him (Great Thinkers, #2)
item.itunes:title: Hugh Ross: The People, Events, and Ideas that Shaped Him (Great Thinkers, #2)
item.description:
Astrophysicist and author Hugh Ross is founder and senior scholar of Reasons to Believe, an organization that researches and communicates how discoveries about nature harmonize with the words of the Bible. His books include The Creator and the Cosmos, Why the Universe Is the Way It Is, Improbable Planet, and Designed to the Core. In this interview, I talk with Dr. Ross about the people, events, and ideas that shaped him.

Reasons to Believe: https://reasons.org/?gclid=Cj0KCQjw756lBhDMARIsAEI0AglSdOe_SeRYGwtmKzdBGmtDlzT0PRySCdBszAGTHcJ9Jte1Z3vt-JoaAnTkEALw_wcB

Great Thinkers Series: https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLj8S949x_pmTeJWbeWyeN0JNAvBZJEzBB&si=e2HnkH4Y95hAikZy

-------------------------------- GIVING --------------------------------

Please consider becoming a Patron!

Patreon (Thanks!): https://www.patreon.com/AdherentApologetics

YouTube Membership: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCO8jj_CQwrRRwwwXBndo6nQ/join

item.description:
In this video, Justin Brierley joins me to chat about his new book, The Surprising Rebirth of Belief in God: Why New Atheism Grew Old and Secular Thinkers Are Considering Christianity Again. We talk about the fading influence of New Atheism, the rise of Jordan Peterson, and how Christianity is coming back into the discussion.

Get the Book Here: https://justinbrierley.com/the-surprising-rebirth-of-belief-in-god/

Justin Brierley: https://justinbrierley.com/about/

-------------------------------- GIVING --------------------------------

Please consider becoming a Patron!

Patreon (Thanks!): https://www.patreon.com/AdherentApologetics

item.title: 312. Mike Rea: Answering Divine Hiddenness
item.itunes:title: 312. Mike Rea: Answering Divine Hiddenness
item.description:
Dr. Michael Rea joined me to discuss Divine Hiddenness, and his book, The Hiddenness of God. We talked about attributes of God, God's presence in the world, and why God appears to be hidden.

The Book: https://www.amazon.com/Hiddenness-God-Michael-C-Rea/dp/019882601X

item.title: 309. Paul Copan: The Old Testament God is Morally Perfect
item.itunes:title: 309. Paul Copan: The Old Testament God is Morally Perfect
item.description:
Dr. Paul Copan joined me to chat about Old Testament Ethics, and his new book, Is God a Vindictive Bully? We chat about slavery, difficult passages, how to interpret the Old Testament, and so much more! Paul Copan (Ph.D., Philosophy, Marquette University) is a Christian theologian, analytic philosopher, apologist, and author. He is currently a professor at the Palm Beach Atlantic University (Florida) and holds the endowed Pledger Family Chair of Philosophy and Ethics.

His Website: http://www.paulcopan.com/about/

The Book: https://www.amazon.com/God-Vindictive-Bully-Reconciling-Portrayals/dp/1540964558/ref=sr_1_1?crid=TUB5EE28LID1&keywords=is+god+a+vindictive+bully+by+paul+copan&qid=1685375777&sprefix=is+god+a+vin%2Caps%2C289&sr=8-1

-------------------------------- GIVING --------------------------------

Please consider becoming a Patron!

Patreon (Thanks!): https://www.patreon.com/AdherentApologetics

YouTube Membership: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCO8jj_CQwrRRwwwXBndo6nQ/join

item.itunes:title: 296. Ted Poston: Intrinsic Probability and Theism: Laying the Foundations for a Theistic Case
item.description:
Ted Poston is Professor of Philosophy and Inaugural Director of the McCollough Institute for Pre-Medical Scholars at the University of Alabama. In this interview, we chat about his paper on the intrinsic probability of theism, atheism, and Axiarchism along with what that means for the God debate!

The paper: https://place.asburyseminary.edu/faithandphilosophy/vol37/iss4/3/

Follow Ted ( @tedtalksphilosophy )

item.description:
R.T. Mullins (PhD, University of St Andrews). He has published over 50 essays on various topics in philosophical theology related to models of God, philosophy of time, personal identity, the problem of evil, disability theology, the Trinity, and the incarnation. In this interview, I chat with Ryan about his paper, One Hell of a Problem for Divine Love.

The paper: https://philpapers.org/rec/MULOHO

item.title: 288. Nelvin Climenhaga: Why (Some) Forms of Skeptical Theism Make Theism Irrational to Believe
item.itunes:title: 288. Nelvin Climenhaga: Why (Some) Forms of Skeptical Theism Make Theism Irrational to Believe
item.description:
Dr. Nevin Climenhaga is a Senior Research Fellow in the Dianoia Institute of Philosophy at Australian Catholic University. In this interview, we talk about challenges for some views of skeptical theism in response to the problem of evil that possibly make theism an irrational belief to hold.

Nevin's Website: https://sites.google.com/site/nevinclimenhaga/

Nevin's Twitter: https://twitter.com/NevinClimenhaga

The Paper: https://philpapers.org/rec/CLIIWC

item.title: 286. Mike Heiser: Unlocking the Supernatural Worldview of the Bible
item.itunes:title: 286. Mike Heiser: Unlocking the Supernatural Worldview of the Bible
item.description:
Michael S. Heiser is an American biblical Old Testament scholar and Christian author. His area of expertise is the nature of the spiritual realm in the Bible, namely the Divine Council and hierarchy of the spiritual order. In this interview, we chat about the divine council, Mike's battle with cancer, and much more!

Connect with Dr. Heiser: https://drmsh.com/

item.content:encoded:
Michael S. Heiser is an American biblical Old Testament scholar and Christian author. His area of expertise is the nature of the spiritual realm in the Bible, namely the Divine Council and hierarchy of the spiritual order. In this interview, we chat about the divine council, Mike's battle with cancer, and much more!

Connect with Dr. Heiser: https://drmsh.com/

item.title: 283. Stephen Meyer: Intelligent Design and It’s Toughest Questions
item.itunes:title: 283. Stephen Meyer: Intelligent Design and It’s Toughest Questions
item.description:
Stephen C. Meyer received his Ph.D. in the philosophy of science from the University of Cambridge. A former geophysicist and college professor, he now directs Discovery Institute’s Center for Science and Culture in Seattle. In this interview, we talk about intelligent design, objections to it, and more. We talk about mechanisms that cause suffering, God of the Gaps, and so much more!

Dr. Meyer's Website: https://stephencmeyer.org/

item.title: 276. Are All Saved? Debating Universalism vs Annihilationism (Andrew Hronich vs. Jim Spiegel)
item.itunes:title: 276. Are All Saved? Debating Universalism vs Annihilationism (Andrew Hronich vs. Jim Spiegel)
item.description:
In this video Andrew Hronich (universalist) debates Jim Spiegel (annihilationist). They talk about history, Biblical passages, and philosophical arguments with regard to the nature of soteriology. Andrew Hronich is a student at Princeton Theological Seminary. Jim has authored numerous books and articles on issues in ethics, aesthetics, philosophy of religion, and popular culture, including the award-winning How to Be Good in a World Gone Bad.

Follow Andrew: https://www.instagram.com/amhronich/

Follow Jim Spiegel: https://jimspiegel.com/

-------------------------------- GIVING --------------------------------

Patreon (Thanks!): https://www.patreon.com/AdherentApologetics

item.itunes:title: 267. Scott Clifton: God, Atheism, Heaven & Hell
item.description:

Scott's Channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/TheoreticalBullshit

item.title: 266. Bethany Sollereder: Why is There Suffering? How You Can Decide
item.itunes:title: 266. Bethany Sollereder: Why is There Suffering? How You Can Decide
item.description:
In this interview, I talk with Dr. Bethany Sollereder about her new book, "Why is There Suffering?" We chat about how you can make a path trying to explain why there is suffering. Bethany Sollereder (PhD, University of Exeter) is a postdoctoral fellow at the University of Oxford. The author of God, Evolution, and Animal Suffering, she writes regularly for journals and popular publications including Christian Century and BioLogos.org.

Bethany's Book: https://www.amazon.com/Why-There-Suffering-Theological-Expedition/dp/0310109027#:~:text=In%20her%20new%20book%2C%20%22Why,research%20fellow%20at%20Oxford%20University.

-------------------------------- GIVING --------------------------------

Patreon (Thanks!): https://www.patreon.com/AdherentApologetics

YouTube Membership: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCO8jj_CQwrRRwwwXBndo6nQ/join

item.itunes:title: 259. Liz Jackson & Justin Mooney: Philosophers Debate God’s Mind: Divine Beliefs and Credences
item.description:

Justin's Website: https://www.justinmooney.net/

item.title: 257. Charles Taliaferro: Why You Are a Soul: A Defense of Dualism & Problems with Physicalism
item.itunes:title: 257. Charles Taliaferro: Why You Are a Soul: A Defense of Dualism & Problems with Physicalism
item.description:
In this interview, I talk with Charles Taliaferro about dualism, the mind, and problems with physicalism. Charles Taliaferro is an American philosopher specializing in theology and philosophy of religion. He is an emeritus professor of philosophy at St. Olaf College, a senior research fellow at the Institute for Faithful Research, and a member of the Royal Institute of Philosophy.

His Books: https://www.amazon.com/Charles-Taliaferro/e/B001IYXGBC%3Fref=dbs_a_mng_rwt_scns_share

-------------------------------- GIVING --------------------------------

item.title: 238. Ken Samples: Why Christians Should be Intellectually Rigorous
item.itunes:title: 238. Ken Samples: Why Christians Should be Intellectually Rigorous
item.description:
Philosopher and theologian Kenneth Richard Samples has a great passion to help people understand the reasonableness and relevance of Christianity’s truth claims. He is the senior research scholar at Reasons to Believe and the author of several books, including Classic Christian Thinkers, 7 Truths That Changed the World, and God Among Sages. In this interview, we talk about the importance of intellectual rigor for Christians.

More About Ken: https://reasons.org/team/kenneth-r-samples

item.title: 224. Daniel Molto: Unseen Animals Don‘t Suffer? A New Approach to Animal Suffering
item.itunes:title: 224. Daniel Molto: Unseen Animals Don‘t Suffer? A New Approach to Animal Suffering
item.description:
Dr. Daniel Molto joins me to discuss his approach to the problem of animal suffering. We talk about why unseen animals may not actually suffer and objections.

item.title: 220. Hugh Ross: Are UFOs the Demonic Presence?
item.itunes:title: 220. Hugh Ross: Are UFOs the Demonic Presence?
item.description:
Astrophysicist Hugh Ross, founder and president of Reasons to Believe, holds a degree in physics from the University of British Columbia and a PhD in astronomy from the University of Toronto. His books include Weathering Climate Change, The Creator and the Cosmos, and Improbable Planet. Hugh has also spoken on hundreds of university campuses as well as at conferences and churches around the world. In this interview, I talk with Dr. Ross about UFOs and their potential implications within Christian theology.

More info about Dr. Ross: https://reasons.org/team/hugh-ross

item.title: 218. Bethany Sollereder: God‘s Love Explains Evolutionary Evils? The Problem of Animal Suffering
item.itunes:title: 218. Bethany Sollereder: God‘s Love Explains Evolutionary Evils? The Problem of Animal Suffering
item.description:
Bethany Sollereder is a Research Fellow at the Laudato Si’ Research Institute at Campion Hall. She specializes in theology concerning evolution and the problem of suffering and is currently working on the theological aspects of our changing climate. In this interview, we talk about the problems of animal suffering, evolutionary evil, and general treatments of the problem of evil.

God, Evolution, and Animal Suffering: https://www.amazon.com/God-Evolution-Animal-Suffering-Routledge-ebook/dp/B07K2FWD6Q

item.title: 216. John Haught: Evolution is Beautiful? An Aesthetic Theodicy for Animal Suffering
item.itunes:title: 216. John Haught: Evolution is Beautiful? An Aesthetic Theodicy for Animal Suffering
item.description:
John F. Haught (Ph. D. Catholic University, 1970) is a Distinguished Research Professor, Georgetown University, Washington DC. In this interview, I talk with Dr. Haught about evolutionary theory and its relationship to Christian Theism. Is evolution evidence against God? How can it be seen in the light of Biblical teaching?

Learn more about Dr. Haught: https://gufaculty360.georgetown.edu/s/contact/00336000014TkWYAA0/john-haught

item.title: 215. Sy Garte: A Scientist Explains Why Evolution May be Evidence for God
item.itunes:title: 215. Sy Garte: A Scientist Explains Why Evolution May be Evidence for God
item.description:
Sy (Seymour) Garte, PhD in biochemistry, is the author of the award-winning book The Works of His Hands: A Scientist’s Journey from Atheism to Faith (Kregel Publications, 2019). He has been a tenured professor at New York University, Rutgers University, and the University of Pittsburgh, division director at the Center for Scientific Review of the National Institutes of Health, and interim vice president for research at the Uniformed Services University of the Health Sciences. In this interview, I talk with Sy about evolution and Christianity. Is evolution contra Christian teaching? Is evolution really random? And much more!

Follow Sy: https://twitter.com/sygarte?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor

-------------------------------- GIVING --------------------------------

Please consider becoming a Patron! I am a full-time student, so your support helps make our content better and provides me Ramen money.

item.itunes:title: 211. Evidence for the Resurrection: Countering @Counter Apologist (Part Two w/ Bram Rawlings)
item.description:

item.title: 203. David Graieg: How Memory Theory & 1 Corinthians 15 Support the Resurrection
item.itunes:title: 203. David Graieg: How Memory Theory & 1 Corinthians 15 Support the Resurrection
item.description:
David Graieg studied Electrical Engineering at the University of Western Australia and Theology at Dallas Theological Seminary. He is currently undertaking a PhD. David has taught apologetics in Singapore and teaches apologetics with Alphacrucis College in Australia. He runs a Reasonable Faith chapter in Perth https://www.reasonablefaithperth.org/ David is married to Grace, and they have three young children.

In this interview, I talk with David about his dissertation on memory theory and its impact on the case for the resurrection, focusing on the creed in 1 Corinthians 15.

-------------------------------- GIVING --------------------------------

Please consider becoming a Patron! I am a full-time student, so your support helps make our content better and provides me Ramen money.

Patreon (Thanks!): https://www.patreon.com/AdherentApologetics

item.title: 199. Zachary Ardern: How Evolution Could Be Evidence of Design
item.itunes:title: 199. Zachary Ardern: How Evolution Could Be Evidence of Design
item.description:
Dr. Zachary Ardern is an evolutionary biologist using microbial genome and gene expression data to answer fundamental evolutionary questions and to understand microbial diversity better. In this interview, we talk about how evolution can be evidence for design.

Dr. Ardern's Website: https://zacharyardern.com/

item.title: 187. Is Naturalism Simpler than Theism? A Response to Emerson Green (w/ Tim Howard & Kyle Alander)
item.itunes:title: 187. Is Naturalism Simpler than Theism? A Response to Emerson Green (w/ Tim Howard & Kyle Alander)
item.description:
Atheist Emerson Green recently released a video titled "Why I am an Atheist." In this video, Kyle Alander ( @Christian Idealism ) and Tim Howard ( @Invoking Theism ) join me to discuss his fourth point where he claims, "Theism is more metaphysically profligate than naturalism as an explanation."

item.title: 186. Lydia McGrew: Is the Gospel of John History?
item.itunes:title: 186. Lydia McGrew: Is the Gospel of John History?
item.description:
Dr. Lydia McGrew is a widely published analytic philosopher and author. She received her PhD in English from Vanderbilt University in 1995. She has published extensively in the theory of knowledge, specializing in formal epistemology and in its application to the evaluation of testimony and to the philosophy of religion.

In this conversation, we talk about your recent book, The Eye of the Beholder and the reliability of John's Gospel.

Dr. McGrew's channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCSwh...

Testify video on unnecessary details: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AzRws...

Testify video on unexplained allusions: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W5mF9...

Purchase link for Hidden in Plain View: https://www.amazon.com/Hidden-Plain-V...

Purchase link for The Mirror or the Mask: The Mirror or the Mask: Liberating the Gospels from Literary Devices: McGrew, Lydia: 9781947929074: Amazon.com: Books

Purchase link for The Eye of the Beholder: The Eye of the Beholder: The Gospel of John as Historical Reportage: McGrew, Lydia: 9781947929159:Amazon.com: Books

-------------------------------- GIVING --------------------------------

Please consider becoming a Patron! I am a full-time student, so your support helps make our content better and provides me Ramen money.

Patreon (Thanks!): https://www.patreon.com/AdherentApolo...

YouTube Membership: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCO8j...

item.title: 179. Paul Barker: A Scholar Explains the Book of Deuteronomy
item.itunes:title: 179. Paul Barker: A Scholar Explains the Book of Deuteronomy
item.description:
Dr. Paul Barker's PhD was published as The Triumph of Grace in Deuteronomy. He has written books and articles on Amos, Psalms, Deuteronomy, and preaching. In this interview, we talk about big questions surrounding the book of Deuteronomy.

item.title: 173. Ken Samples: Faith, Slavery, & Other Objections to Christianity from New Atheism
item.itunes:title: 173. Ken Samples: Faith, Slavery, & Other Objections to Christianity from New Atheism
item.description:
Philosopher and theologian Kenneth Richard Samples has a great passion to help people understand the reasonableness and relevance of Christianity’s truth claims. He is the senior research scholar at Reasons to Believe and the author of several books, including Classic Christian Thinkers, 7 Truths That Changed the World, and God Among Sages. In this interview, I chat with Kenneth about his latest book and questions relating to the rationality, relevance, and goodness of Christianity.

Ken's Book: https://www.amazon.com/Christianity-Cross-Examined-Rational-Relevant-Good-ebook/dp/B093KN4NN6/ref=sr_1_1?dchild=1&qid=1623345858&refinements=p_27%3AKenneth+Samples&s=digital-text&sr=1-1

-------------------------------- GIVING --------------------------------

Please consider becoming a Patron! I am a full-time student, so your support helps make our content better and provides me Ramen money.

Patreon (Thanks!): https://www.patreon.com/AdherentApologetics

YouTube Membership: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCO8jj_CQwrRRwwwXBndo6nQ/join

item.title: 170. Joe Schmid: The Aloneness Argument Against Classical Theism
item.itunes:title: 170. Joe Schmid: The Aloneness Argument Against Classical Theism
item.description:
Joe Schmid from the Majesty of Reason joins me to discuss the Aloneness argument. We talk about how possible alone worlds can count as evidence against Classical Theism.

item.title: 165. Jay Skalr: A Scholar Explains the Book of Leviticus
item.itunes:title: 165. Jay Skalr: A Scholar Explains the Book of Leviticus
item.description:
Dr. Jay Sklar is a professor of the Old Testament at Covenant Seminary. He was a partial editor of the ESV Study Bible's footnotes on Leviticus and published commentaries on the book. We talk about struggles with Leviticus, laws, purity, and more.

More Info on Dr. Sklar: https://www.covenantseminary.edu/faculty/jay-sklar/

Patreon (Thanks!): https://www.patreon.com/AdherentApologetics

YouTube Membership: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCO8jj_CQwrRRwwwXBndo6nQ/join

YouTube Interview: https://youtu.be/iu5me0TPzoA

item.title: 154. Ross Blackburn: Exodus and Apologetics
item.itunes:title: 154. Ross Blackburn: Exodus and Apologetics
item.description:
Dr. Ross Blackburn has been ordained for 20 years and has served as Rector of Christ the King for the past 10. He earned a Master of Divinity at Trinity School for Ministry, and a PhD in Biblical Studies at the University of St. Andrews, Scotland. In this interview, we talk about big questions in Exodus such as how it lays a missional foundation.

Dr. Blackburn's church: http://www.christthekingboone.com/

item.title: 140. Casey Luskin: Is Intelligent Design a Good Argument for God?
item.itunes:title: 140. Casey Luskin: Is Intelligent Design a Good Argument for God?
item.description:
Casey Luskin has a Ph.D. in Geology from the University of Johannesburg, and a B.S. and M.S. in earth sciences from the University of California at San Diego, where he studied geology and evolution extensively at both the graduate and undergraduate levels. He also has a law degree from the University of San Diego and is a California-licensed attorney. He works at Discovery Institute as Associate Director for the Center for Science and Culture. In this interview, I talk with Casey about the status of intelligent design!

Support (thank you): https://www.patreon.com/AdherentApologetics

Casey's Website: http://www.caseyluskin.com/​

Casey’s Bio: https://www.discovery.org/p/luskin/​

item.title: 139. Ryan Mullins: Examining Divine Simplicity
item.itunes:title: 139. Ryan Mullins: Examining Divine Simplicity
item.description:
Ryan Mullins has published over 30 essays on various topics in philosophical theology related to models of God, philosophy of time, personal identity, the problem of evil, disability theology, the Trinity, and the incarnation. He has published two books, The End of the Timeless God (Oxford University Press, 2016) and God and Emotion (Cambridge University Press, 2020).

Ryan's Podcast: https://www.rtmullins.com/

Support (thank you): https://www.patreon.com/AdherentApologetics​
item.content:encoded:
Ryan Mullins has published over 30 essays on various topics in philosophical theology related to models of God, philosophy of time, personal identity, the problem of evil, disability theology, the Trinity, and the incarnation. He has published two books, The End of the Timeless God (Oxford University Press, 2016) and God and Emotion (Cambridge University Press, 2020).

Ryan's Podcast: https://www.rtmullins.com/

item.title: 121. Michael Strauss: Does Science Support a Beginning and Fine-Tuning?
item.itunes:title: 121. Michael Strauss: Does Science Support a Beginning and Fine-Tuning?
item.description:
Michael Strauss is an experimental particle physicist currently doing research on the ATLAS detector, one of the two multi-purpose particle detectors located on the Large Hadron Collider at CERN near Geneva, Switzerland. He is also a professor at the University of Oklahoma in Norman since 1995. In this conversation, we talk about how science supports arguments for God's existence.

Support (thank you): https://www.patreon.com/AdherentApologetics

Dr. Strauss' Website: https://www.michaelgstrauss.com/

item.title: 117. Hugh Ross: How Science Points to God's Existence
item.itunes:title: 117. Hugh Ross: How Science Points to God's Existence
item.description:

item.title: 115. Rob Koons: Is There a Necessary Foundation?
item.itunes:title: 115. Rob Koons: Is There a Necessary Foundation?
item.description:
Dr. Rob Koons specializes in philosophical logic and in the application of logic to long-standing philosophical problems, including metaphysics, philosophy of mind and intentionality, semantics, political philosophy and metaethics, and philosophy of religion. In this conversation, we talk about arguments for a first cause and a necessary foundation.

Rob's Website: http://robkoons.net/

item.title: 114. Leighton Ryder: Medieval Christian Mysticism, Marguerite Porete, and Your Theology
item.itunes:title: 114. Leighton Ryder: Medieval Christian Mysticism, Marguerite Porete, and Your Theology
item.description:
Leighton Ryders writes about Theology, Philosophy, Apologetics, and History. He is a university student who is majoring in History (Honours) and minoring in Religious Studies. More specifically he studies Medieval European Ecclesiastic Reform & Mystic History.

Marguerite Porete was a Beguine mystic burned in 1310 for heresy. We talk about her life, mysticism, women in the church, heresy, heterodoxy, and views of sanctification.

Support (we're 85% funded): https://www.patreon.com/AdherentApologetics

Leighton's Website: https://academictheist.wixsite.com/admcthst

item.itunes:title: 112. Richard Playford: Examining Thomistic Teleological Arguments
item.description:
Today, Dr. Richard Playford joins me to discuss a form of the argument from design. Richard Playford is a lecturer in religious studies and the programme lead for the BA (Hons) in theology, religion and ethics and the BA (Hons) in theology and religious studies at St Mary’s University. His research interests include ethics, bioethics, metaphysics and philosophy of religion.

Support (thank you): https://www.patreon.com/AdherentApologetics

Richard's Website: https://sites.google.com/view/richard...

The Philosopher's Cave: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCENw...

item.title: 105. Khaldoun Aziz Sweis: What a Philosopher Learned About Evil After His Son's Death
item.itunes:title: 105. Khaldoun Aziz Sweis: What a Philosopher Learned About Evil After His Son's Death
item.description:
Khaldoun Aziz Sweis, PhD is former Chair and currently Associate Professor of Philosophy at Olive-Harvey College in Chicago and serves as a tutor in philosophy with Oxford University in England. He was born in Amman, Jordan. His experience entails teaching philosophy for over a decade as well as speaking at conferences both nationally and abroad such as Hong Kong, Romania, Australia and England. He has three books, including Debating Christian Theism (Oxford University Press 2011) and the newest being, Killing God: How to Respond to the Seven Most common objections of the New Atheism. He is a member of the American Philosophical Association. 

Support (thank you): https://www.patreon.com/AdherentApologetics

Website: https://logicallyfaithful.com/about-me/

Blog: https://www.logicallyfaithful.com/sev...

item.title: 74. Craig Blomberg: A Scholar Responds to Common Objections to the Gospels
item.itunes:title: 74. Craig Blomberg: A Scholar Responds to Common Objections to the Gospels
item.description:
Dr. Craig Blomberg is Distinguished Professor of New Testament at Denver Seminary in Littleton, Colorado. He holds the B.A. from Augustana College in Rock Island, Illinois, the M.A. from Trinity Evangelical Divinity School in Deerfield, Illinois, and the Ph.D. from the University of Aberdeen, Scotland. Craig is the author of sixteen books and has co-authored or co-edited ten more, along with more than 150 journal articles or chapters in multi-author works.

In this interview, I talk with Dr. Craig Blomberg about questions relating to the Gospels such as their authorship, textual variants, and other important questions.

Craig's Books: https://www.amazon.com/s?i=stripbooks...

Support (thank you): Patreon (Thanks!): https://www.patreon.com/AdherentApolo...

David Pallmann runs the YouTube channel Faith Because of Reason, a channel that adheres to a Molinist theology, Arminian soteriology, orthodox Preterist eschatology, Biblical inerrancy, and the classical apologetic method. In this interview, I talk with David about common misconceptions about Arminianism. 

Subscribe to Faith Because of a Reason: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC8sT..

item.itunes:title: 52. Haden Clark vs Godless Engineer: Did Paul Believe in a Historial Jesus?
item.description:
Haden Clark (Help Me Believe) and John Gleason (Godless Engineer) debate the thesis, "Did Paul Believe in a Historical Jesus?' A historical Jesus is being understood in terms of "walked the face of the earth, and was crucified on earth around 30 CE." Haden will defend the affirmative using only Paul's genuine letters.

 

Support: https://www.patreon.com/AdherentApologetics

item.title: 51. Gary Habermas: How Near Death Experiences Point to an Afterlife
item.itunes:title: 51. Gary Habermas: How Near Death Experiences Point to an Afterlife
item.description:
In this interview, I talk with Dr. Gary Habermas about how Near Death Experiences (NDE's) point to an afterlife. We talk about what a NDE is, how they point to an afterlife, answering objections, and more.

Dr. Gary Habermas has taught at the college, seminary, and graduate-level for over 40 years. He is also an author or editor of some 37 books, of which 18 are on the subject of Jesus’ resurrection.

Support for this podcast (thanks): https://www.patreon.com/AdherentApologetics

item.title: 50. Jay Medenwaldt: How Psychology Impacts Apologetics
item.itunes:title: 50. Jay Medenwaldt: How Psychology Impacts Apologetics
item.description:
Jay has an MA in Cognitive Psychology, an M.Div in Apologetics, Ethics, and Biblical Studies and is pursuing a Ph.D. in Social and Personality Psychology from Baylor University.

In this interview, I talk with Jay about the field of psychology and how it relates to apologetics. We talk about how psychological research relates to understanding bias, decision making, persuasion, the mind, consciousness, mental health, and more! 

Support the podcast: https://www.patreon.com/AdherentApologetics

item.title: 48. Lindsey Medenwaldt: Sharing the Gospel with Jehovah's Witnesses
item.itunes:title: 48. Lindsey Medenwaldt: Sharing the Gospel with Jehovah's Witnesses
item.description:
Lindsey is the Executive Director of Mama Bear Apologetics. She has been writing a world religion blog for Mama Bear for the past two years, and she also contributed a chapter about the Jehovah's Witnesses for the forthcoming (March 2021) Harvest House book "The Popular Handbook of World Religions."

In this interview, I talk with Lindsey about how we as Christians can reach Jehova's Witnesses. We talk about the history of the Jehova's Witnesses, what they believe, and how we as Christians can share the Gospel with them.

Support the show (thank you): https://www.patreon.com/AdherentApologetics

item.title: 44. Samuel Casado: Turning your Apologetics into Evangelism
item.itunes:title: 44. Samuel Casado: Turning your Apologetics into Evangelism
item.description:
In this conversation, I talk with Sam about the importance of apologetics pertaining to evangelism. We talk about practically using your apologetics knowledge and the importance of trusting God.

Samuel Hubner Casado used to work in Dutch entertainment as an actor and singer, but left the industry in his mid-twenties when he acutely developed severe hyperhidrosis. Today, he is one of the Netherlands’ most prominent videogame critics, while working as the team lead for one of Canada's largest YouTube channels.

item.title: 1. Rashawn Copeland Interview: The Power of the Gospel
item.itunes:title: 1. Rashawn Copeland Interview: The Power of the Gospel
item.description:
In this interview, Zac talks with Rashawn Copeland about how the Gospel has the power to change your life. Rashawn talks about his testimony, how to grow in your faith, and about spreading the Gospel in the modern-day.

Rashawn Copeland is an Evangelist, Published Author, and Medical Service Officer in the United States Army. He also currently enrolled in a seminary program at Liberty University. In this interview, Rashawn talks about his own testimony and the liberating power of the Gospel.
